abstract: It's staggering to contemplate how much the Apple co-founder understood about modern America that those who govern it still don't.
snippet: It's staggering to contemplate how much the Apple co-founder understood about modern America that those who govern it still don't.
lead_paragraph: As in most other big American cities, it would be hard to walk 100 feet in Washington and not slam into somebody who's using something that Apple created - an iPhone or an iPad or a Macbook Pro. And so it's staggering to contemplate just how little of Steve Jobs's genius ever permeated the nation's politics, and how much he understood about modern America that those who govern it still don't.

headline.main: What Steve Jobs Understood That Our Politicians Don't
